For example,

# "Filter 2" has query *filter = "Filter 1"*

If you change filter name of "Filter 1" to "Filter 3" it should also be reflected automatically in "Filter 2"-s query and become *filter = "Filter 3"*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31992].
  {panel}

Jira issues can have non UTF-8 content in summary and description fields. 

When requesting these issues via the Jira REST API, the returned content is non UTF-8 encoded. 
However, the Content-Type response header always specifies the content as 'application/json;charset=UTF-8'

The Content-Type response header in the REST API should match the actual encoding of the content and vice versa.
fields.summary: JIRA REST API - Actual content encoding does not match response Content-Type
JQL support 'IN' operator to allow matching of a set of text values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31990].
  {panel}

I mean to say when there will be more comments if the user want to go to top directly in a issue than the user has to scroll through. If there will be button like "Go to Top" like marketing site to go to top. That will be great.

1. It would be bater if the "Go to Top" button should not visible until it crosses some marked area in the screen.
2. The "Go to Button" should be a hanging one. I mean to say when the user scroll through the issue, the button should go down along with the scroll.

Hope I am not disturbing your development team. This is a suggestion to make JIRA users more comfortable.
fields.summary: Add "Go to Top" button to issue

fields.description:
I have a few question about JIRA integration with active directory. This is non production system & we are using the default database HSQL DB. The version of JIRA is 5.0 (JIRA (v5.0#713-sha1:aec58e2)).
I have dedicated user & password to access the LDAP. When we enable the active directory, JIRA reads all the AD users & loads it to active cache. It takes about 22 min (1354 sec) to fetch all 55000 odd records. The application is very slow during the process of syntonization. 
Here are my questions
1. In general do you know if you login to JIRA with your AD credential does JIRA goes to LDAP & authenticates the user or does it authenticate against the active cache that it holds (copy of LDAP).
2. There is an attribute : "directory.cache.synchronise.interval": "3600" that defines the synchronize interval. How can I change synchronise interval to 1 day.
3. How can we increase the size of active cache
fields.summary: JIRA integration with Active Directory
Limit the number of issues that are in a certain status per user
Missing Drag and Drop
Be able to specify the width of columns in the Sub-tasks section of the Issue View
Links to issues which have been cloned in jira.atlassian.com are now automatically redirected to the clone, which are sometimes restricted to Atlassian staff

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31980].
  {panel}

*Reproduction Steps*
* For an OnDemand instance (with Giffy for JIRA 3.8), set its license to a license key which does not allow users to use Gliffy
* Hit URL https://<hostname>/rest/ondemand/license/latest/license/load, to force the license to propogate
* As admin, go to https://<hostname>/secure/admin/GliffyLicenseAction.jspa

*What Happens*
* Gliffy for JIRA OnDemand license type information is displayed incorrectly

!gliffy_invalid_license.png!

From the above scenario, the license information should be displayed as "Atlassian OnDemand License (Inactive)".

This is a *regression* from Gliffy for JIRA version 3.7.2
fields.summary: Gliffy for JIRA OnDemand licensing information displayed incorrectly when license doesn't include Gliffy for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31979].
  {panel}

h4. Use case
# An LDAP user directory in JIRA is created with 'Read Only with Local Groups'
# An LDAP user is then placed in a local group, e.g. 'jira-users'
# Later, it is decided that this group's memberships will be handled in LDAP, and a group of the same name is created (again for example 'jira-users')

The result is that the LDAP 'jira-users' members never get synced over since there's already an existing local group of the same name that contained at least one LDAP member at some point in time.

h4. Purpose
The purpose of this improvement request is to investigate a way allow the LDAP group to override the local group in this senario. In the mean time, there's a workaround, detailed below.

h4. Workaround
When the LDAP user is placed in the local group, a new row will be created in the _cwd_group_ table associating the local group with the _directory_id_ of the LDAP user directory. The row will have the _local_ column set to '1' indicating that it is not a group from LDAP.

This flag, when set to '1', apparently keeps the LDAP group of the same name from syncing.

# Shut down JIRA
# Update the row such that the _local_ column is set to '0'
# Start JIRA, which will trigger a sync on startup

Please note the impact this will have on your user memberships:
* Local users and groups are not affected
* LDAP users in the local group will no longer have that membership relationship
* LDAP users will now belong in the LDAP group of the same name
fields.summary: Investigate a way to override local groups with LDAP groups of the same name when using 'Read Only with Local Groups'
Email headers, subject, or from address should be different for mentions, ticket updates, and watches, etc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31977].
{panel}
|Thank you for your votes and comments on this ticket. 
  
 Quick update, we've run some tests and we will be ready to start delivering the fix for this issue in JIRA Cloud this month. 
 All goes well and it will be available in your instance before December 2021. Thank you for your patience.
  
 Ivan Ran,
 Software Engineer, Jira
  |
h3.  

<customfield id="customfield_10930" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiversion">
 <customfieldname>Target Release</customfieldname>
 <customfieldvalues>
 <customfieldvalue>36029</customfieldvalue>
 </customfieldvalues>
 </customfield>

As a result, the issue macro display result of Target Release as 36029 instead of 13.04

*Steps to Reproduce*
 * Create a custom field in JIRA that deals with versions (either 'Version Picker' or 'Multi Version Picker')
 * Open any ticket and try to add these versions and put the values
 * Use the JIRA XML API to get the value of these custom fields
 * Expectation to see the values of these versions
 * Actual, we only see the IDs of these versions
fields.summary: xml view of custom field of multiversion picker type display version ID instead of version text
Need more fields in versions tab
Allow workflow creation/modification permissions to project administrators
Allow Expandable sub-tasks in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31971].
  {panel}

TL;DR: JIC needs a "scalable" mode where collectors can be deployed into tens of thousands of websites without crashing the JIRA instance hosting JIC. And neither should JIC represent a single point of failure for those other websites.

When JIC has a "scalable" mode, we have to update the jira-feedback-plugin in JIRA to use that mode.

----
I'm currently investigating performance issues on JAC and the issue collector is causing quite a bit of overhead. (https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/ADM-33614)

In particular the request for /rest/collectors/1.0/configuration/trigger/d3de7fb5 (which any client with an issue collector will send) causes quite a bit of load on the server hosting issue collectors.

When this resource is hit it causes DB lookups:
{noformat}
"http-127.0.0.1-9080-119" daemon prio=10 tid=0x0b4db000 nid=0x1d01 runnable [0x55699000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:129)
	at org.postgresql.core.VisibleBufferedInputStream.readMore(VisibleBufferedInputStream.java:135)
	at org.postgresql.core.VisibleBufferedInputStream.ensureBytes(VisibleBufferedInputStream.java:104)
	at org.postgresql.core.VisibleBufferedInputStream.read(VisibleBufferedInputStream.java:73)
	at org.postgresql.core.PGStream.ReceiveChar(PGStream.java:259)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1620)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:257)
	- locked <0x78e4b558> (a org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:479)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeWithFlags(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:367)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeQuery(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:271)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:96)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:96)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeQuery(SQLProcessor.java:597)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectListIteratorByCondition(GenericDAO.java:1061)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectByAnd(GenericDAO.java:608)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findByAnd(GenericHelperDAO.java:131)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findByAnd(GenericDelegator.java:788)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findByAnd(GenericDelegator.java:773)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findByAnd(GenericDelegator.java:750)
	at com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.ofbiz.OFBizPropertySet.findPropertyEntry(OFBizPropertySet.java:298)
	at com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.ofbiz.OFBizPropertySet.getType(OFBizPropertySet.java:159)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.JiraCachingPropertySet.getType(JiraCachingPropertySet.java:661)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor277.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.pluginsettings.LazyProjectMigratingPropertySet$PropertySetInvocationHandler.invoke(LazyProjectMigratingPropertySet.java:57)
	at $Proxy1841.getType(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.pluginsettings.JiraPluginSettings.getActual(JiraPluginSettings.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.pluginsettings.AbstractStringPluginSettings.get(AbstractStringPluginSettings.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.components.CollectorStoreImpl.getCollector(CollectorStoreImpl.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.components.CollectorServiceImpl.getCollector(CollectorServiceImpl.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest.ConfigurationResource.findCollectorById(ConfigurationResource.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest.ConfigurationResource.getTriggerConfiguration(ConfigurationResource.java:41)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor315.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.expand.interceptor.ExpandInterceptor.intercept(ExpandInterceptor.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper.invokeMethodWithInterceptors(DispatchProviderHelper.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker._dispatch(DispatchProviderHelper.java:230)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.method.dispatch.ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.dispatch(ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.java:75)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.HttpMethodRule.accept(HttpMethodRule.java:288)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RightHandPathRule.accept(RightHandPathRule.java:147)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.ResourceClassRule.accept(ResourceClassRule.java:108)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RightHandPathRule.accept(RightHandPathRule.java:147)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RootResourceClassesRule.accept(RootResourceClassesRule.java:84)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl._handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1469)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl._handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1400)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1349)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.handleRequest(WebApplicationImp
{noformat}

Also the response is returned with no-cache headers:
{noformat}Cache-Control:no-cache, no-store, no-transform{noformat}

This means that if an issue collector is enabled in OnDemand for example, every single OnDemand user will trigger a request to JAC for every single page-pop which will potentially hit the DB if the propertysets aren't cached in memory.

I think we should consider:
* Moving issue collectors to ActiveObjects which may be more efficient than the currently ugly pluginsettings storage (where everything is split across multiple DB rows)
* Adding temporary cache headers to this response so not every single end-user page-pop hits JAC.  I think we don't have cache headers to allow editing of collectors, but surely several hours to see edits on the client is acceptable for a feature like this.

Effectively the issue collector in OnDemand is launching a DDOS attack on JAC currently.
fields.summary: Issue collector causes performance issues on host JIRA instance
Improve the current process of merging two OnDemand instances to retain GreenHopper data
Unable to define JQL for a Webhook

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31959].
  {panel}

Customer has two projects: DASH and AUT.

DASH has 260 issues AUT has 70 issues.

New bug in DASH becomes DASH-261. 

From the more actions, the customer moves DASH-261 to the AUT project. 

AUT-71 is created. 

New bug in DASH becomes DASH-262. 

The customer feels that the bug should be DASH-261, not DASH-262 since DASH-261 was moved to AUT-71.  

Auto incrementing was explained. However, the customer feels that auto incrementing tickets should be specific to each project. In other words, moving a ticket to another project would automatically free up and preserve that ID for the next bug. 

Cheers,
Jason | Atlassian
fields.summary: Ticket numbers keep incrementing even though we are moving ticket to another project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31953].
{panel}
 
h3. Description

As mentioned in the [Webhooks documentation page|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/], authentication is only supported when building connect add-ons since in this case the outgoing calls are signed with your app's _sharedSecret_:
{quote} * Declare a [webhook module in the descriptor of your Atlassian Connect app|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/modules/webhook/] (this will register the webhook for your app automatically and ensures webhooks are signed with your app's {{sharedSecret}}){quote}
 

 

It would be nice to have the possibility to configure authentication credentials (basic auth or oauth token) also when [creating the Webhooks from the UI|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/manage-webhooks/].
h3. Workaround

You can configure an [automation rule|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automate-your-jira-cloud-processes-and-workflows/] (global or project specific) that, when specific conditions are matched, sends an outgoing request using the [Send outgoing web request|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/] automation action.

For further details on this please see:
 - [Automation for Jira - Send web request using Jira REST API|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Automation-for-Jira-Send-web-request-using-Jira-REST-API/ba-p/1443828]
fields.summary: Webhooks authentication (basic auth and others)
Ability to create issues by email on different projects using the same email account.
Long image attachments issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31950].
  {panel}

If you delete a custom field from Jira which still is used in a post function of the workflow then this workflow post function cannot be edited anymore.
When performing the transition Jira will display the following error:
!1.png!

If the post function is set upon creation of a case then Jira will display the error but still create the case, the case will be in an incorrect workflow step.

The only way to remove the post function from the workflow is by generating an xml export, deleting the function from the code and re-import the workflow
(Needs to be done by support for OnDemand instances)
Example:
{noformat}
<function type="class">
<arg name="field.value">UEC_SI</arg>
<arg name="class.name">com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.function.UpdateIssueCustomFieldPostFunction</arg>
<arg name="field.name">customfield_10384</arg>
</function>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Do not allow deletion of custom field if used in a workflow post-function
Issue - Time Tracking - Log Work Plus Button Does Not Work
Upgrade Remote Apps to 0.4.518.6

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31945].
  {panel}

Create a project in JIRA called ABC.

Run the following Jelly script using the Jelly Runner:
{code:xml|title=Create a custom field|borderStyle=solid}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateCustomField fieldType="select" fieldScope="global" fieldName="Severity" searcher="multiselectsearcher" customFieldIdVar="custField">
        <jira:AddCustomFieldSelectValue value="Low"/>
        <jira:AddCustomFieldSelectValue value="Medium"/>
        <jira:AddCustomFieldSelectValue value="High"/>
    </jira:CreateCustomField>
    <jira:AddFieldToScreen screen="Default Screen" fieldId="${custField.getId()}"/>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

Now attempt to create a JIRA issue, setting the value of the Severity field:

{code:xml|title=Set the value of the custom field|borderStyle=solid}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" summary="foo" issueType="Bug" reporter="admin">
        <jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Severity" value="Medium"/>
    </jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

The following error message appears:

{code:xml|title=Error message|borderStyle=solid}
Jelly script ran and produced the following messages.
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira='jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib'>
  <Error action='CreateIssueDetails'>
    <TagContents>(CreateIssue(summary=foo)(reporter=admin)(issuetype=1)(project-key=ABC)(priority=3)(issueType=Bug)(pid=10200)(customfield_10501=Medium))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=admin</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>
Result=input
customfield_10501: Invalid value 'Medium' passed for customfield 'Severity'. Allowed values are: 10103[Low], 10104[Medium], 10105[High], -1
</ErrorMessage>
  </Error>
  <Error action='CreateIssueDetails'>
    <TagContents>(CreateIssue(summary=foo)(reporter=admin)(issuetype=1)(project-key=PKZ)(priority=3)(issueType=Bug)(pid=10200)(customfield_10501=Medium))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=admin</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>
Result=input
Error for field "customfield_10501" : Invalid value 'Medium' passed for customfield 'Severity'. Allowed values are: 10103[Low], 10104[Medium], 10105[High], -1
</ErrorMessage>
  </Error>
</JiraJelly> 
{code}

It seems that the following statement can be executed successfully, but of course, you have to know which id to use.

{code:xml|title=Set a custom field by id|borderStyle=solid}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" summary="foo" issueType="Bug" reporter="admin">
        <jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Severity" value="10104"/>
    </jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{code}
fields.summary: Allow custom Select fields to be set by value (not just id)

fields.description:
*Reproduction Steps*
Click edit for a "Comment Required Validator" (new or existing) for a workflow transition

*What Happens*
* User is unable to edit the "Comment Required Validator"
* The following JS error is thrown from EditWorkflowTransitionValidatorParams!default.jspa line 266:
{code}Uncaught ReferenceError: NREUMQ is not defined{code}

Please see http://screencast.com/t/N1dYiFdIuKh2 for reference
fields.summary: Cannot edit "Comment Required Validator"

fields.description:
*Reproduction Steps*
Create/Edit a "Parent Status Validator" for a workflow transition, with 1 or more statuses selected

*What Happens*
Selected statuses for "Parent Status Validator" is displayed incorrectly as the following: $textutils.htmlEncode($selectedStatuses)

!parent_status_validator.png!

The impact is that users cannot easily identify the statuses set for this validator without editing the validator.
fields.summary: Selected statuses for "Parent Status Validator" displayed incorrectly
Fixes required for JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions 2.5.5

fields.description:
"Mentions" don't seem to be working in my new Jira 5.2 installation.  If, in a comment, I type an '@' and begin typing a username, the drop-down does appear with a list of matching users.  Selecting a user changes the typed content to [~ username] (without the space).  Posting the comment, however, the [~ username] text does not change to a reference to the user and the intended user is not notified of the attempted mention.

Possibly worth noting, I have Crowd managing my users.
fields.summary: Mentions not working
Mail subscription should run based on the user's profile timezone instead of the system timezone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31934].
  {panel}

The week number on the Calender is shown incorrectly with 2 week number 1 if you change the default language to German, France and Spanish. Was able to recreate this on Chrome Browser.

Refer to the screenshot below:
!calendererror.jpg!

*Steps to reproduce*
# Add a date picker on the Default Screen
# Change to German Language as the default language
# View the calender and change to January (Januar)
# Notice that there are two week 1

Note: This behavior is not noticeable on Firefox (19.0) and Internet Explorer (10), only Chrome (25.0) are affected   

*Workaround*
# Look and Feel (g + g + Look and Feel) and scroll to the bottom, on the option Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker, change to yes.
# Change default language to English
fields.summary: Week Number in Calender Error for German, France and Spanish Default Language in Chrome Browser

that user doesn't get added. What happens instead is that the user that was used to authenticate gets added to the watcher list.

fields.description:
I search for users in group 'BO-User'. As the result one user is displayed, who is not in the group.

Something like that I had already with the group jira-users. Here it was even more annoying because in our JIRA test instance we only can add 10 users to group jira-users and they were exhausted by several corrupt users in half.

Ability to restrict Sub-Tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31912].
  {panel}

In JIRA Resolve Issue or Close Issue transition screen, we can see the following message appears in the screen:
!resolveissue.png! 

Looking at the workflow transition configuration in JIRA UI, users are not able to find the source of the message in the transition screen. However if we look at the workflow .xml file, the message is actually controlled by the following property and the message is coming from JIRA i18n file:
{code:xml}
<meta name="jira.i18n.description">resolveissue.desc.line1</meta>
{code}

However if we try to add the {{jira.i18n.description}} property directly in a workflow transition in JIRA UI, user will get the following error:
!error.png!

Hence, the only way for user to add the property is to modify the workflow .xml file manually. 

It will be great if users are able to add the {{jira.i18n.description}} property directly from JIRA workflow transition properties configuration. 

Sample use case: user may have created a new workflow with a new set of screen, and would like to add the message on their own custom screen on the custom workflow.
fields.summary: Add the ability to define the "jira.i18n.description" property in JIRA workflow transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

The turorial in https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JRJC/Tutorial is out of sync with the  jira-rest-java-client/2.0.0-m2 API, as the class JerseyJiraRestClientFactory is missing.

Please either:
a) Update the tutorial
b) Fix the API

The last version that seems to contain the missing class si jira-rest-java-client/1.1-m2.
But the javadoc of this version does not contain information about JerseyJiraRestClientFactory 

Please include this class into the javadoc
fields.summary: JerseyJiraRestClientFactory missing in jira-rest-java-client/2.0.0-m2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31907].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Use Safari in private browser mode or configure your browser to disallow local storage (see screenshot).
# Install GreenHopper and go to the TaskBoard.
# Move a card to a new state.

*Result:* A JS error (QUOTA_EXCEEDED_ERR, line 21 in [persistence.js|https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/browse/jira/jira/trunk/jira-components/jira-webapp/src/main/webapp/includes/ajs/persistence/persistence.js?hb=true#to21]) is thrown after the ajax request completes, which leaves the page in a bad state -- e.g. dialog doesn't close. (See screenshot attached.)

*Expected result:* QUOTA_EXCEEDED_ERR errors should be handled with a try/catch around localStorage/sessionStorage setItem() calls. ([example|https://bitbucket.org/shghs/aui/src/c22b40ee9a0b/src/storage.js#cl-24])

*Workaround:* Use Safari in non-private mode (i.e. normal mode) or re-enable local storage.
fields.summary: Unhandled sessionStorage QUOTA_EXCEEDED_ERR JavaScript errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31900].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have the results of a saved filter return via the REST api similar to the following URL examples:

'https://myserver/rest/api/latest/filter/{id}\?searchurl'
or
'https://myserver/rest/api/latest/filter/{id}\?results'

Scenario:

I am using a popular PC based spreadsheet application as a reporting tool with data from JIRA and other sources.  If, during the course of business, I need to fine tune the results of the filter it would be nice to update the filter only within JIRA and have the results displayed in the reporting tool.
fields.summary: return results from saved filter via rest api

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31893].
  {panel}

When you are on a selection or issue card and you click Share, you can send an email. You can enter a large number of people, but when you add more people than visibly fit in the screen you can never reach the Note field or Share button.

*Reproduction:*
* Go to a selection (filter) or issue.
* Click 'Share'.
* Add many user names, until the bottom ones disappear from view.
* Try to reach the note field and Share button, either by scrolling in the browser or using the arrow keys.

*Another Step to Reproduce this error*
* You can also resize the note area to be longer than the dialog box

This is reproducible both in IE9 and Chrome25.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31892].
  {panel}

By default, when a user is not logged on to Jira and Jira allows anonymous access (Browse Project: Anyone). The user avatars will be reset to the Jira default display picture shown below instead of the user configured avatars. This has been highlighted before on JRA-25705 but it was describe in the case of email client.
!defaultavatar.png!

(i) This is replicable on the jira.atlassian.com

There are scenarios where the customer still want to show the user avatars to the anonymous users for better identification. Customer would like to have an option to choose whether to show or hide the user avatar to anonymous users.

To show avatar, anonymous user would able to view the user avatar.

To hide avatar, anonymous user would only see the default Jira avatar.
fields.summary: Option for User Avatar to be Shown to Anonymous Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31890].
  {panel}

An initial import is created with a selection of fields checked on the right-hand side for retained settings, i.e. 'Issue Type', 'Priority'. 'Severity'.

Additional map field selections that were not checked will appear in the 'CSV-configuration' file that is produced at the end of an import.

The impact of this issue is reusing the configuration file selects mappings users did not want to retain.  I have been able to replicate this behaviour when the JIRA field was a custom field.

Cheers,
Paul
fields.summary: Saved configuration file retains mappings that were unselected
Prevent JIRA from sending notifications for minor changes.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31882].
  {panel}

Test was performed on 5.2.7 with no plugins. It was done only against the summary field.

Test issue summary was: "Test_1234"

1. summary ~ 'test_1234' - Full match with underscore WORKS.
2. summary ~ 'test_123' - Partial match with underscore FAILS.
3. summary ~ 'test_123*' - Partial match with underscore and wildcard WORKS.
4. summary ~ 'test_' - Partial match with no trailing characters after the underscore returns many issues which do not contain an underscore, one that does "Test Test _ Test Test", but not the one we want. FAILS.
5. summary ~ 'test_*' - Partial match with a wildcard WORKS.
6. summary ~ 'est_1234'- Partial match with missing leading characters. FAILS.
7. summary ~ 'est' - Partial match with missing leading characters and no underscore. FAILS.
8. summary ~ '*est' - Leading wildcards are prohibited by the system.

I kind of understand 6 and 7 not working because we only claim to perform "simple derivatives of that word" in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-CONTAINS:~ but in concert with test 8, it means that you can not do any kind of mid word matching.

Tests 2 and 4 seem to meet the requirement of "simple derivatives of that word" in that it is a string with a number of values removed from the end. How do we distinguish between test 4 failing, vs test 5 working?

Test 4 also shows that the underscore "_" character is not being correctly handler by Lucene as it brings up a number of issues where "test" is mentioned in the summary but no underscore is present.

Consistency in the behavior of this operator should be improved.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior with contains operator

In a enterprise environment, the JIRA instance could under intensive Remote API access which can up to 10 K request per minute, and it is actually difficult for  customer to keep monitor and limit the Remote API access via JIRA it self.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31859].
  {panel}

This may or may not be the right place for this.

I've set up a subscription to be emailed to me every day from EACJ.  My profile was set up to receive the emails via Text. 

Each morning I receive the email but the formatting is off which makes the links useless.  It appears to be adding the issue key to the previous summary link.  The screenshots may tell a better story.  The 1st one is what the email looks like.  The 2nd one is of the error message and format of the link int he address bar.

I did change the email format to HTML and it solved the incorrect linking but still not wild about the format b/c we're using sub-tasks. The summary section  includes the parent issue in the summary links.  

PS: What happened to the issue collector on EACJ.  Those things are awesome.

h5. Findings:
* The problem happens to users that using plaintext for email and only happens to subscriptions.
* Reported working fine in Outlook client and working fine in Ymail as well. It seems only impact Gmail client.
* Ran a lots of testing and a possible cause of the problem seems to due to length of the link/base url. I tried with 51 characters for the whole link: https://localhost.ismylove.com/123/browse/TESTING-3 and the subscription render nicely. If I change the base url slightly to https://localhost.ismylove.com/1234/browse/TESTING-3 the link rendering would be broken for 52 characters.
fields.summary: Filter subscriptions in text have long links mangled
Default incoming mail handler reset after instance upgrade and maintenance
JIRA get issue resource returns all comments
Add resolved option to JIRA Issues Calendar gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31855].
  {panel}

IF an IN Clause in JQL contains a single element which does not exist (e.g. a non-existent issue key), then the entire Query fails.

e.g. a Valid IN CLAUSE

* https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/search?jql=issuekey%20in%20(JRA-9)

and invalid IN CLAUSE

* https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/search?jql=issuekey%20in%20(JRA-9,%20JRA-0)
yields:
* {"errorMessages":["An issue with key 'JRA-0' does not exist for field 'issuekey'."],"errors":{}}


We would like the IN clause in JQL to operate the same as the IN Clause in SQL.
If one or more elements do not exist, then they should simply be ignored.

The reason for this is to avoid N queries to a JIRA instance when looking for bulk JIRA Issue information, such as is needed in the FishEye Release Report. i.e. - here is a bunch of JIRA issues - go and fetch their summaries.
If the above error messages were machine readable, I guess we could get away with 2 queries - the first one to filter the issue keys that don't exist and the second one to query the issue summaries.
fields.summary: The JQL IN clause should handle invalid issueKeys

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

# Is it possible to provide an update task for the user who is using the customized project key to migrate the project key to the normalized project key?

For example, I have a Group Picker custom field called Team as part of my Bug issue type.  I want to find all Bugs where the assignee is not part of the Group assigned to that issue.

assignee NOT IN membersOf(Team)

Another scenario is straight comparison.  I want to identify all areas where the "fixVersion" is the same as the "foundVersion"

fixVersion = foundVersion

fields.description:
I have trouble with behaviour of JIRA, when I use function "Search for Issue".  When I asked for all my issues, I recieve result with 142 records which is OK. After it, I add a criteria - issue will contain word mushroom and I know, no issue contain this word.

In the Chrome (v.24), I recieve a list of 142 records - no refresh of the list. Which is strange.  When I click on magnifier by right mouse button in the text field frame, and select reload, I recieve empty list, which is correct.

In the Internet Explorer (v9), I recieved message in pink frame:
The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
fields.summary: Find Issue - using same form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31838].
  {panel}

The 'Attach Screenshot' action fails with the following error:

*{{ClassNotFoundException com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreeshotApplet.class}}*

The workaround is to take a screenshot using [your operating system's usual method|http://www.take-a-screenshot.org/] and then upload the resulting file using JIRA's 'Attach file' action.

h4. Update
This has been fixed for all Atlassian OnDemand instances. *Safari* browser might require its cache to be cleared before the fix will be in effect.
fields.summary: Attaching screenshot throws ClassNotFoundException com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreenshotApplet.class
